channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Plane Crashes Near São Paulo, Brazil, Killing 62 On Board
item.description: The Brazilian authorities said no one survived the crash, outside São Paulo on Friday afternoon. The airline, VoePass, said the cause was unknown.

item.title: Israel-Hamas War: White House Issues Rare Criticism of Israeli Minister Who Opposes Cease-Fire
item.description: John F. Kirby, a national security spokesman, rebuked Israel’s finance minister, Bezalel Smotrich, in unusually harsh terms and accused him of being willing to sacrifice Israeli hostages.

item.title: Here’s what it takes to become a track and field Olympian: speed, strength, ‘fearlessness’
item.description: Fearlessness, speed, and strength are all crucial attributes, coaches explain.

item.title: New 9/11 Evidence Revives Questions About Hijackers’ Saudi Ties
item.description: The F.B.I. received a trove of evidence from British authorities between 2001 and 2002. Two significant pieces of information, which were not shared with the 9/11 Commission, have recently emerged.

item.title: Plane Crashes Near São Paulo, Brazil, Killing 62 On Board
item.description: The Brazilian authorities said no one survived the crash, outside São Paulo on Friday afternoon. The airline, VoePass, said the cause was unknown.

item.title: Bad bosses are pushing Gen Zers and millennials to the brink
item.description: No one wants to be a manager anymore, and poor management leaves millennials and Gen Zers especially upset.

item.title: As Ukraine Pushes Deeper Into Russia, Moscow Sends Reinforcements
item.description: The Ukrainian police said they were evacuating people, perhaps in anticipation of a retaliatory strike, but the goal of the military operation on Russian territory remained unclear.

item.title: Plane Carrying 62 People Crashes in Brazil
item.description: The Brazilian authorities said the crash outside of São Paulo killed everyone onboard the plane, which was operated by the airline VoePass.

item.title: Stellantis to cut up to 2,450 jobs at Detroit-area plant where Ram ‘Classic’ production will end
item.description: The automaker said Friday the cuts accompany its decision to end output later this year of its Ram 1500 Classic truck model at the plant.

item.title: Was the Great Brooklyn Goldfish Heist a Rescue? Or a Robbery?
item.description: In Bedford-Stuyvesant, an animal lover thought she was doing the right thing by freeing fish from a sidewalk pit. The man who created the pond saw it differently.

item.title: Making House Calls to Mongolia’s Herders
item.description: Health workers travel great distances, sometimes on horseback, to provide basic services to the country’s semi-nomadic populations.

item.title: Sen. Elizabeth Warren asks Tesla’s board to probe Elon Musk’s potential conflicts of interest
item.description: Musk acknowledged in June he sent graphics processing units from Tesla to X and artificial intelligence venture xAI Corp., saying they would have otherwise sat in a warehouse.

item.title: Biden Promised Peace, but Will Leave His Successor a Nation Consumed by War
item.description: The president has spent much of his tenure mobilizing military might against Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and supporting Israel.

item.title: As Ukraine Pushes Deeper Into Russia, Moscow Sends Reinforcements
item.description: The Ukrainian police said they were evacuating people, perhaps in anticipation of a retaliatory strike, but the goal of the military operation on Russian territory remained unclear.

item.title: Georgia Tech professor: Banning AI from school is a mistake
item.description: AI is the next technology that every student needs to know a bit about to navigate our modern times.
